meanings.definition: A person who makes an unreasonable profit, especially by taking advantage of a situation.
meanings.sent1: The profiteer charged way too much for the water during the drought.
meanings.sent2: The profiteer in the market exploited the shortage of masks to raise prices.
meanings.sent3: The profiteer at the lemonade stand tried to sell a glass for a hundred dollars!
meanings.sent4: The profiteer was like a cunning fox, always seeking ways to maximize earnings.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the profiteer, lurking to capitalize on any misfortune for personal gain.

meanings.definition: To make an unreasonable profit, especially by taking advantage of a situation.
meanings.sent1: Some sellers profiteer during emergencies by inflating prices.
meanings.sent2: It is unethical to profiteer from people's urgent needs.
meanings.sent3: The shop owner decided to profiteer by doubling the cost of the rare item.
meanings.sent4: She managed to profiteer off the limited edition sneakers by selling them at a high price.
meanings.sent5: The company chose to profiteer off the crisis instead of offering fair prices to customers.
